name: SPORT BUFF
slogan: We're going to change the way people watch live sports. Forever
description:
Powerful social gaming over live video.

Sport Buff is next generation audience engagement for sports video. We engage viewers through live predictions, polls, votes and more over the top of video content - live, replay and highlights. 

Even with time-shifted audiences, Sport Buff is the tool to bring the vibrancy and excitement of the live experience, over the top of replay content. 

We are currently working on a new campaigns in football (soccer), esports, basketball and more with world's leading rightsholders.

jobs.title: Golang Developer with Devops Experience
jobs.description:
**Buff is looking for a Golang Developer with Devops Experience to join us on our journey of changing the live sports experience for 1bn sports fans.**

### The Role

We are looking for a Golang Engineer with experience in Devops.
You will be responsible for developing and maintaining our REST API (written in Golang) as well as handling deployment/management/troubleshooting of our AWS infrastructure

### Key Responsibilities

* Τechnical design and architecture
* Code new features as well as maintaining existing features
* Write technical documentation
* Participate and run code reviews
* Prototype new and redesign features
* Provide unsolicited advice on the product
* Fixing bugs

### Minimum Requirements

* Experience with Golang (2+ years)
* Excellent experience creating and running web APIs
* Excellent experience with databases
* Excellent experience with testing
* Experience building high-performance and fault-tolerant applications.
* Experience with cloud based applications
* AWS hands on experience to be able to maintain current infrastructure
* Experience using DevOps-focused technologies, such as Docker, Terraform and CircleCI
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

**Bonus Points:**

Experience with Agile development and rapid iteration cycles
A background in startups
Experience working with live sports data feeds and APIs (OPTA, Sportradar, etc)
Being a fan of live sports and watching sports

### What we offer

Work remotely from anywhere you like
Flexible working hours (we do require 4 hours 12:30 GMT - 16:30 GMT availability)

**No dev houses or recruiters please
Please only apply if you are based within -/+4 hours GMT.**


### To apply please fill the form in the link below

https://forms.gle/9w6sFstdaSGC83Ux5

jobs.title: Javascript Developer with NPM Package Development Experience
jobs.description:
Buff is looking for a Javascript Developer with experience creating an SDK  and npm package build and development to join us on our journey of changing the live sports experience for 1bn sports fans.

**The Role**

We are looking for a top skilled JavaScript Developer who will create the Web Version of our Mobile SDK’s.
Our ideal candidate has extensive knowledge of vanilla JavaScript/CSS/HTML and he will be responsible for creating and distributing our web version library as an npm package.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Build our Web Version SDK as an npm package
* Maintain and add new features to that Web Version SDK
* Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
* Build and improve our Web Dashboards
* Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders

**Minimum Requirements**

* Proficient understanding of JavaScript, its quirks, and workarounds
* Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5 and CSS3
* Proficient understanding of asynchronous request handling, partial page updates, and AJAX
* Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around such issues
* Previous experience with building and releasing npm package
* Good understanding of browser rendering behavior and performance
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git

**Bonus Points:**

* Knowledge of any modern JS framework such as ReactJS/VueJs/AngularJS 
* Experience with Agile development and rapid iteration cycles
* A background in startups
* Being a fan of live sports and watching sports

**What do Send**

* Your CV
* Links to your GitHub, LinkedIn and StackOverflow profiles
* Anything that reflects on your knowledge and experience in the field


**What we offer**

Work remotely from anywhere you like
Flexible working hours (we do require 4 hours 12:30 GMT - 16:30 GMT availability)

**No dev houses or recruiters please
Please only apply if you are based within -/+3 hours GMT.**
